title.narrative: IR 2. PLAIDOYER POUR L'ENGAGEMENT DES A

description.narrative: Output 2014-2015: By the end of December 2015, four ministries (MENA, MASSN, MATDS, MESS) in collaboration with national NGOs and civil society and media undertake more initiatives to promote PFE+ for the respect of the right of the child to education and protectionOutput 2011-2013: By 2013, at least 50 per cent of stakeholders (local authorities, CBOs, opinion leaders, young men/women, and the media) commit to promoting the six key family practices., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Human Rights Institutions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2015, 40 per cent of men and women adopt the six key family practices (exclusive breastfeeding, sleeping under insecticide-treated mosquito nets, handwashing with soap, treatment of diarrhoea using Oral Rehydration Solution (ORS), Prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) of HIV, and complementary infant feeding) for child survival and development, with at least a 30 per cent increase in each practice nationwide.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2014-2015: By the end of December 2015, four ministries (MENA, MASSN, MATDS, MESS) in collaboration with national NGOs andcivil society and media undertake more initiatives to promote PFE+ for the respect of the right of the child to education andprotectionOutput 2011-2013: By 2013, at least 50 per cent of stakeholders (local authorities, CBOs, opinion leaders, youngmen/women, and the media) commit to promoting the six key family practices.

description.narrative: The C4D unit developed strong partnerships to bring together and build synergy among implementing partners from various thematic areas of Child Protection (child marriage, FGM and child labour in artisanal mines). Capacity building was provided to 1130 community relays to implement sensitization activities on these themes through 24 radios stations | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2017
